Description: Near miniature limestone tablet bearing scratched Greek text. Rectangular plaque, with left side damaged, above a peg-like base. Incised lines frame the plaque on the front and on at least two sides on the rear. Possibly part of a larger composition?
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 73. Name, Heliskos
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XX, no. 35)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p.16, no.71)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.05)
